alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Niagara; Northern Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 2:33PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Wyoming, northeastern Erie, southern Niagara and western Genesee Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 233 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grand Island, or 7 miles south of Niagara Falls, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 35 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, Niagara Falls, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lackawanna, Kenmore, Depew, Tonawanda, Amherst, Lancaster, Williamsville, Darien Lakes State Park, Grand Island, Elma, Pendleton, Marilla, Pembroke and Akron. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 55 and 48A. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for western New York.
